column.name: id
column.remarks: Represents a randomly generated alphanumeric identifier.

column.name: name
column.remarks: Represents the login/screen name.

column.name: phone
column.remarks: Represents the mobile phone number used for registration.

column.name: email
column.remarks: Represents the email address.

column.name: first_name
column.remarks: Represents the first name.

column.name: last_name
column.remarks: Represents the last name.

column.name: dob
column.remarks: Represents the date of birth.

column.name: status_id
column.remarks: Represents the status.

column.name: stature_id
column.remarks: Represents the stature or level of influence.

column.name: active
column.remarks: Indicates activity status.

column.name: auth_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the user last authenticated.

column.name: phone_verified_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the user phone number is verified.

column.name: email_verified_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the user email address is verified.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the record was created.

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the record was last modified.

createTable.remarks: Represents the conditions that afflict a person.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: Refers to the person.

column.name: condition_id
column.remarks: Refers to the condition.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the record was created.

createTable.remarks: Represents the exposure possibilities for a person.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: Refers to the person.

column.name: exposure_id
column.remarks: Refers to the exposure.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the record was created.

createTable.remarks: Represents the symptoms that currently afflict a person.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: Refers to the person.

column.name: symptom_id
column.remarks: Refers to the symptom.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the record was created.

column.name: sex_id
column.remarks: Represents the biological gender of the user.

column.name: latitude
column.remarks: Represents the GEO coordinates of the user's primary location - latitude property.

column.name: longitude
column.remarks: Represents the GEO coordinates of the user's primary location - longitude property.

column.name: alertable
column.remarks: Indicates that a user wishes to be notified with pertinent information.

createTable.remarks: Represents locations to be tested or receive treatment.

column.name: name
column.remarks: Represents the name of the facility.

column.name: address
column.remarks: Represents the street address of the facility.

column.name: city
column.remarks: Represents the city where the facility is located.

column.name: state
column.remarks: Represents the state where the facility is located.

column.name: latitude
column.remarks: Represents the GEO coordinates of the facility's location - latitude property.

column.name: longitude
column.remarks: Represents the GEO coordinates of the facility's location - longitude property.

column.name: phone
column.remarks: Represents the phone number of the facility.

column.name: appointment_phone
column.remarks: Represents the appointment phone number of the facility.

column.name: email
column.remarks: Represents the contact email of the facility.

column.name: url
column.remarks: Represents the main web site URL of the facility.

column.name: appointment_url
column.remarks: Represents the appointment web site URL of the facility.

column.name: hours
column.remarks: Represents the hours of operation of the facility.

column.name: type_id
column.remarks: Represents the facility type indicator.

column.name: drive_thru
column.remarks: Does the facility have a drive-thru at this location?

column.name: appointment_required
column.remarks: Does the facility require an appointment?

column.name: accepts_third_party
column.remarks: Does the facility accept third party referrals?

column.name: referral_required
column.remarks: Does the facility require a referral?

column.name: test_criteria_id
column.remarks: Refers to the Testing Criteria.

column.name: other_test_criteria
column.remarks: Represents the other testing criteria details for the facility.

column.name: tests_per_day
column.remarks: Represents the facility's daily testing capacity.

column.name: government_id_required
column.remarks: Does the facility require government identification?

column.name: minimum_age
column.remarks: Represents the facility's minimum age to perform tests.

column.name: doctor_referral_criteria
column.remarks: Represents the critera the doctors require for a referral.

column.name: first_responder_friendly
column.remarks: Does the facility provide courtesy services for healthcare workers and first responders?

column.name: telescreening_available
column.remarks: Does the facility provide telescreening?

column.name: accepts_insurance
column.remarks: Does the facility accept insurance?

column.name: insurance_providers_accepted
column.remarks: Represents the insurance providers the facility accepts.

column.name: free_or_low_cost
column.remarks: Does the facility provide free or low cost tests?

column.name: notes
column.remarks: Represents additional notes about the facility.

column.name: active
column.remarks: Indicates activity status.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the record was created.

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the record was last modified.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: Refers to the person.

column.name: type_id
column.remarks: Refers to the test type.

column.name: taken_on
column.remarks: Represents the date on which the test was taken.

column.name: facility_id
column.remarks: Refers to the testing facility.

column.name: positive
column.remarks: Indicates whether the results were affirmative.

column.name: notes
column.remarks: Represents additional details.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the record was created.

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the record was last modified.

changeSet.author: smalleyd
changeSet.sql: ALTER TABLE facility MODIFY COLUMN url VARCHAR(255) DEFAULT NULL COMMENT 'Represents the main web site URL of the facility.'; ALTER TABLE facility MODIFY COLUMN appointment_url VARCHAR(255) DEFAULT NULL COMMENT 'Represents the appointment web site URL of the facility.';

rollback.sql: ALTER TABLE facility MODIFY COLUMN url VARCHAR(128) DEFAULT NULL COMMENT 'Represents the main web site URL of the facility.'; ALTER TABLE facility MODIFY COLUMN appointment_url VARCHAR(128) DEFAULT NULL COMMENT 'Represents the appointment web site URL of the facility.';

column.name: health_worker_status_id
column.remarks: Refers to the state of employment as a healthcare worker.

changeSet.author: smalleyd

createTable.remarks: Represents the changes of symptoms over time.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: Refers to the person.

column.name: symptom_id
column.remarks: Refers to the symptom.

column.name: started_at
column.remarks: Represents when this round of a symptom started.

column.name: ended_at
column.remarks: Represents when this round of a symptom ended.

changeSet.author: smalleyd
changeSet.sql: UPDATE people SET health_worker_status_id = 'n' WHERE health_worker_status_id IS NULL; ALTER TABLE people MODIFY COLUMN health_worker_status_id CHAR(1) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'n' COMMENT 'Refers to the state of employment as a healthcare worker.';

rollback.sql: ALTER TABLE people MODIFY COLUMN health_worker_status_id CHAR(1) DEFAULT NULL COMMENT 'Refers to the state of employment as a healthcare worker.'; UPDATE people SET health_worker_status_id = NULL WHERE health_worker_status_id = 'n';

changeSet.author: smalleyd
changeSet.sql: INSERT INTO symptoms_log (person_id, symptom_id, started_at) SELECT person_id, symptom_id, created_at FROM symptoms;

changeSet.author: smalleyd
changeSet.sql: ALTER TABLE symptoms_log RENAME INDEX person_id TO unq_symptoms_log;

rollback.sql: ALTER TABLE symptoms_log RENAME INDEX unq_symptoms_log TO person_id;

column.name: location_name
column.remarks: Represents the full address of the person used during geocoding.

createTable.remarks: Represents bookmarked facilities by a person.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: Refers to a person.

column.name: facility_id
column.remarks: Refers to a facility.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the record was created.

changeSet.author: smalleyd

column.name: alerted_of
column.remarks: Represents the number of new facilities found when attempting the last alert for the user. Zero indicates that no actual alert was sent.

column.name: alerted_at
column.remarks: Represents when the last facility alert was attempted-for/sent-to the user.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: Refers to the person initiating the request.

column.name: invitee_id
column.remarks: Refers to the person receiving the request.

column.name: accepted_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the request was accepted.

column.name: rejected_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the request was rejected.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the record was created.

createTable.remarks: Represents a persistent friendship after the request has been accepted.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: Refers to the my side of the friendship.

column.name: friend_id
column.remarks: Refers to the friend.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the record was created.

changeSet.author: smalleyd

createTable.remarks: Represents visibility to the fields of the people profile.

column.name: id
column.remarks: Refers to a person.

column.name: visibility_health_worker_status_id
column.remarks: Represents the visibility of a person's health worker status.

column.name: visibility_conditions
column.remarks: Represents the visibility of a person's conditions.

column.name: visibility_exposures
column.remarks: Represents the visibility of a person's exposures.

column.name: visibility_symptoms
column.remarks: Represents the visibility of a person's symptoms.

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the record was last modified.

changeSet.sql: INSERT INTO people_field (id, updated_at) SELECT id, created_at FROM people

createTable.remarks: Represents the test types associated with a facility.

column.name: facility_id
column.remarks: Refers to the Facility.

column.name: test_type_id
column.remarks: Refers to the Test Type.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the record was created.

changeSet.author: smalleyd

column.name: activated_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the facility is first marked active.

changeSet.sql: UPDATE facility SET activated_at = updated_at WHERE active = TRUE

column.name: can_donate_plasma
column.remarks: Indicates that the facility accepts plasma donations.

createTable.remarks: Represents the feedback by a user regarding their experience with a facility.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: Refers to the person.

column.name: facility_id
column.remarks: Refers to the testing facility.

column.name: positive
column.remarks: Indicates whether the user experience was overall positive with the facility.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the record was created.

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the record was last modified.

createTable.remarks: Represents optional structured commentary for a specific experience.

column.name: experience_id
column.remarks: Refers to the experience.

column.name: tag_id
column.remarks: Refers to the experience tag.

column.name: result_notification_enabled
column.remarks: Indicates that the facility has contracted to have their results sent directly to their patients via SMS, email, or push notification.

createTable.remarks: Represents the associates of a facility who can act on a facility's behalf.

column.name: facility_id
column.remarks: Refers to a facility.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: Refers to a person.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the record was created.

column.name: password
column.remarks: Represents the hashed secret used for credential authentication.

column.name: remote_id
column.remarks: Represents an identifier in the facility's system of record.

column.name: received_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the results are received and potentially communicated to the patient.

createTable.remarks: Represents people who sought the services of a facility.

column.name: facility_id
column.remarks: Refers to the facility.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: Refers to the person/patient.

column.name: alertable
column.remarks: Indicates that a patient wishes to be notified with their test results.

column.name: enrolled_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the patient accepts enrollment request.

column.name: rejected_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the patient rejects enrollment request.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the record was created.

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Represents the date-time when the record was last modified.

column.name: county_id
column.remarks: Represents a US county FIPS identifier.

column.name: county_name
column.remarks: Represents a US county name.
